intro: Verbesina albissima, commonly known as the white crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces fluffy, white pappus structures that aid in seed dispersal. It thrives in wetland habitats and is often found along the edges of swamps and marshes. Its botanical structure supports its role as a wetland indicator species and a food source for various pollinators.
